Tasks.Task Description: Identify the specific analytics goals and use cases for Azure Databricks, such as data processing, machine learning, or real-time analytics.
Evaluate the data sources, formats, and volume to determine integration requirements with Azure Databricks.
Plan the workspace architecture, including cluster configurations, workspace regions, and integration with Azure services like Azure Data Lake or Azure Blob Storage.
Create an Azure Databricks workspace in the Azure portal, ensuring proper subscription and resource group selection.
Set up virtual networks, private endpoints, and firewall rules to secure the Databricks workspace. Implement role-based access control (RBAC) for user permissions.
Create and configure Databricks clusters based on workload requirements, including autoscaling and instance types.
Connect Azure Databricks to data sources such as Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Database, or external databases. Configure data ingestion pipelines.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure secure access policies and audit logging for compliance.
Create notebooks and workflows for data processing, transformation, and analytics using Apache Spark and Databricks utilities.
Run test cases to validate the performance and accuracy of analytics workflows. Optimize code and cluster configurations as needed.
Configure monitoring tools like Azure Monitor and Databricks metrics to track cluster performance, job execution, and resource utilization.
Create detailed documentation for the Databricks setup, including architecture diagrams, configurations, and operational procedures.
Conduct training sessions for team members on using Azure Databricks, managing clusters, and developing analytics workflows.
Ensure the Databricks setup adheres to regulatory compliance standards. Schedule regular audits to verify security and data governance policies.
